intro: Acrothamnus montanus, commonly known as mountain acrothamnus, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and small, ovate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense clusters, typically during the summer months. It is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Acrothamnus montanus is an important component of local ecosystems, providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
